title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Don Sweeney expressed confidence that the Bruins will be competitive this season, emphasizing health and younger players stepping up.
The Bruins will start the season without a captain, allowing team leadership to emerge naturally over time.
Several young players, including Fraser Minten and Matt Poitras, are expected to vie for key roles in the Bruins' lineup.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants, including two from Boston, made The New York Times' list of 50 best restaurants.
Boston's La Padrona and McGonagle's gained recognition, showcasing Italian and Irish cuisine respectively.
Connecticut's Haring’s and Maine's Pilgrim’s Inn and Sammy’s Deluxe were also featured on the list.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots waived cornerback DJ James after he stood out in preseason, having limited role in season opener.
DJ James, a Seattle 2024 sixth-round pick, spent his rookie season mostly on Patriots' practice squad.
Patriots' cornerback depth is affected by Christian Gonzalez's injury; team allowed 362 passing yards against Raiders.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may get married in Rhode Island. Here’s everything we know about the possible wedding plans.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may marry in Rhode Island, potentially at Swift's mansion in Westerly, by summer 2026.
The couple announced their engagement on Instagram with Swift sporting a large ring, confirming Kelce's proposal in August.
Swift's 11,000-square-foot 'Holiday House' in Watch Hill underwent $1.7 million in renovations, indicating potential wedding site preparations.

title: 2 cyclists medflighted after Mass. crashes
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 63-year-old female cyclist was medflighted after being struck by a car in Gloucester, sustaining serious injuries.
A 15-year-old cyclist in Norwood was medflighted with nonlife-threatening injuries after a car collision on Walpole Street.
Both drivers involved in the incidents were present at the scene; investigations into the crashes are ongoing.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: North Andover police officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons released on house arrest after arraignment for assault with a dangerous weapon.
Fitzsimmons faces restrictions including wearing a GPS device, no contact with her infant son, and confinement to her parents' home.
Incident involved Fitzsimmons allegedly aiming a gun at an officer; she claims it was a suicide attempt amid a custody dispute.

title: N.H. woman indicted for allegedly distributing ‘animal crush’ videos
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lynn Seymour, 51, of Manchester, NH, indicted for distributing and managing groups sharing 'animal crush' videos.
Seymour allegedly shared videos on platforms like Facebook and Telegram, depicting severe animal cruelty.
She faces charges with potential penalties of up to 12 years in prison and $500,000 in fines.

title: Tom Brady talks Netflix roast, ‘most rewarding’ Super Bowl win on Kevin Hart’s ‘Cold as Balls’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady discussed his most rewarding Super Bowl win, selecting his Buccaneers championship as the most significant.
Brady addressed the eventful Netflix roast and mentioned its impact on his children’s feelings.
Brady praised Patrick Mahomes as a quarterback with potential for a historic legacy, noting changes in the game since 2000.

title: What issues are most important to you in the Boston mayoral, City Council election?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston's preliminary elections on Sept. 9 will determine which candidates advance to the Nov. 4 general election.
Key issues for Boston voters include housing affordability, public safety, immigration policies, and infrastructure concerns.
Residents cite high rent prices and safety issues at Mass and Cass as significant factors influencing their votes.

title: Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: CNN named Moshup Beach on Martha's Vineyard one of the best nude beaches in the U.S.
Moshup Beach features multicolored clay cliffs and surfing options, with both clothing-optional and required sections.
Visitors can explore nearby attractions like the historic Gay Head Lighthouse and the Aquinnah Cultural Center.
